quote.#text: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to recoup certain bonuses or awards paid to employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

official-title-amendment.#text: Amend the title so as to read:

official-title.#text: To amend title 38, United States Code, to authorize the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to recoup certain bonuses or awards paid to employees of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
committee-name.#text: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

header.#text: Review of lists of former prisoners of war

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall review the VA POW list and the DOD POW list to identify any discrepancies in such lists.

text.#text: The

header.#text: Review of lists of prisoners of war

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall review the process by which the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Inspector General of the Department of Veterans Affairs

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines that a veteran is a former prisoner of war, including whether the
is following guidelines established by the
to determine that a veteran is a former prisoner of war.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to
a report on the VA POW list, including the following:

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
Any discrepancies, by period of conflict, in the number of prisoners of war included on the VA POW list and the DOD POW list.

With respect to veterans included on the VA POW list who are not included on the DOD POW list, information regarding how such determinations were made, including what types of evidence were used, in a manner that does not personally identify such veterans.

header.#text: Limitation on expansion of dialysis pilot program

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall not expand the dialysis pilot program or create any new dialysis capability provided by the
in any facility that is not an initial facility until after the date that—

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: has implemented the dialysis pilot program at each initial facility for a period of not less than two years;

text.#text: the
an independent analysis of the dialysis pilot program has been conducted at each initial facility; and
the report required by subsection (b) has been submitted.

a report that—

text.#text: Not later than 60 days after the date of the completion of the independent analysis required by subsection (a)(2), the
includes the results of that independent analysis, including a comparison of not only cost but non-cost factors such as access to care, quality of care, and Veteran satisfaction; and
addresses any recommendations with respect to the dialysis pilot program provided in a report prepared by the

that exist as of the date of the enactment of this Act, including any community dialysis provider with which the
has entered into a contract or agreement for the provision of such care.
